conclusion: Understanding the problem setup and given values
Plank leaning against a smooth vertical wall with a block at the lower right
Identify forces on the plank: weight, normal force from wall, force F2, normal force from block, friction force
Identify forces on the block: weight, applied force F1, normal force from plank, friction force
Establish coordinate system aligned with the plank
Resolve forces on the block to find components along and perpendicular to the plank
Plank forms a right triangle with the wall and floor
Condition for upward motion: F1 component along plank must overcome friction
Derive inequality for F1: F1 > (mg(sinθ + μcosθ))/(cosθ - μsinθ)
Calculate F1 using θ = 45°: F1 > 12 N
Final answer: F1 must be greater than 12 N for upward motion
